bibl.title: Letter from Cesar Rodriguez Exposito to Cornelia Knox Kean, November 14, 1952 [Enclosed in 06504126]

div1.p: Rodriguez Exposito invites Kean to a ceremony unveiling a bust of the heroes of the yellow fever experiments and a plaque honoring those involved in the experiments.

div1.head: Letter from Cesar Rodriguez Exposito to Cornelia Knox Kean, November 14, 1952 [Enclosed in 06504126]
div1.opener:
Patronato Pro-Conservación de la Caseta
de los Trabajos Comprobatorios del
Descubrimiento de Finlay
-----
Marianao November 7 of 1952
Mrs Jefferson Randolph Kean.
2804 N Street, N.W.
Georgetown, Washington D.C.
U.S.A.
Dear Mrs Kean:
div1.p:
In the name of Dr Alberto Recio, Pro-Conservation Patronate
President, Building Numberl Lazear Camp; where the work proving, the dis-
covery of Dr Carlos. J. Finlay, I have the honor to invite you on the act
of unveiling the bust, Drs Walter Reed, James Carroll, Jesse Lazear, Aris-
tides Agramonte, General Leonard Wood, Carlos. J. Finlay and Claudio Delga-
do, as well as, the plates with the volunteers names, such experiments and
the persons who took parts on the same (where the name of General Kean is
included).

Said act will take place 3rd December at 10.00 A.M. on the spot Lazear
Camp, “San José” farm, Pogolotti, District Marianao, Havana, Cuba. We hope
to have the honor your accompany us, on said ceremony.
div1.closer:
Yours Very Sincerely: C R Exposito Cesar Rodriguez Exposito.
Secretary
MR; Cesar Rodriguez Exposito.
Marti 219- Marianao
Havana, CUBA.
